Appearance

LegoDOMBuild Reactive Web Components

A tiny, zero-dependency Web library for creating reactive Web Components directly in the browser

Get Started
View on GitHub
Try Examples
üéØ

Mental Model Simplicity

No virtual DOM, no compilation step, no JSX. Just HTML with a few directives and reactive objects.

‚ö°

Zero Dependencies

Under 500 lines of code with no external dependencies. The entire library is smaller than most framework router plugins.

üîÑ

True Reactivity

Direct object mutation triggers updates. No setters, no actions, no reducers. Just change the data and the DOM updates.

üß©

Web Components Native

Built on standard Web Components with Shadow DOM. Works anywhere, plays well with existing code.

üì¶

Single File Components

Use .lego files with Vite for a modern development experience, or load directly in the browser.

üé®

Scoped Styles

Shadow DOM encapsulation means your styles never leak. Use the 'self' keyword to target component root.

üõ£Ô∏è

Built-in Router

Client-side routing included. Define routes, handle parameters, and add middleware without extra packages.

üí™

TypeScript Ready

Full JSDoc annotations for excellent IDE support and optional TypeScript integration.

üöÄ

Production Ready

Battle-tested patterns from Vue and React, adapted for pure Web Components. No framework lock-in.

Quick Example ‚Äã

html
<!-- Define a component -->
<template b-id="counter-button" b-data="{
  title: 'My counter',
  count: 0
}">
  <style>
    self {
      display: block;
      padding: 1rem;
    }
    button {
      font-size: 1.2rem;
      padding: 0.5rem 1rem;
    }
  </style>
  
  <h2>{{ title }}</h2>
  <button @click="count++">
    Clicked {{ count }} times
  </button>
</template>

<!-- Use it -->
<counter-button b-data="{ title: 'Override b-data title' }"></counter-button>

<script src="https://unpkg.com/lego-dom/main.js"></script>

That's it. No build step, no npm, no configuration.

Why Lego? ‚Äã

For small projects, you get reactive components without the overhead of a full framework.

For large projects, you get a clear mental model and Web Standards compliance.

For learning, you can read the entire source code in an afternoon and understand exactly how it works.

Comparison ‚Äã

FeatureLegoVueReact
Size< 17KB~33KB~40KB
Dependencies0ManyMany
Build RequiredNo*YesYes
Virtual DOMNoYesYes
Learning CurveMinimalModerateModerate
Web ComponentsNativeOptionalNo

* Optional with Vite for .lego files

Browser Support ‚Äã

Lego works in all modern browsers that support:

  • Web Components
  • Shadow DOM
  • ES6 Proxy
  • Template literals

This includes Chrome 63+, Firefox 63+, Safari 11.1+, and Edge 79+.
